excuses: It was too cold at Soldier Field.
The grass was too slippery.
The refs clearly missed that pass interference in the 2nd quarter.
We are just one elite quarterback away.
The double doink still haunts our psyche.
It's a rebuilding century.
The wind was blowing the wrong way during the field goal.
We played better if you exclude the scoring drives.
The 1985 defense wouldn't have allowed that.
The headsets were malfunctioning.
It's hard to catch the ball when it's that inflated.
We were looking ahead to next week.
The Packers get all the calls from the league office.
Our offensive coordinator is playing 1D chess.
We were trying out a new defensive scheme that hasn't been perfected.
The bus arrived late to the stadium.
The sun was in our eyes (even in a night game).
We wanted to give the fans a dramatic finish.
Our star kicker has a hangnail.
The turf was too fast for our linebackers.
We're keeping our best plays secret for the playoffs.
The altitude in Green Bay is different.
We have a better history, even if the scoreboard doesn't show it.
The play clock was definitely faster than usual.
Wait until next year.
